initialnote: Mosques and key religious sites in Iran that attract millions of Muslim pilgrims each year were closed in mid-March.Hassan Rouhani on  25th May, holy sites can open one hour after dawn and must close one hour before According to Agence France-Presse, worshippers at the Shah Abdol-Azim shrine in southern Tehran were required to wear a mask, walk through a disinfection tunnel and have their temperature checked.it is assumed that there is no restriction on gathering now with precautionary measures. According to Reuters 25th May, 2020, Palestinian Prime Minister Mohammad Shtayyeh said , churches and businesses in the occupied West Bank will reopen on Tuesday in an easing of coronavirus restrictions.    Linkhttps://web.archive.org/web/20200530090935/https://english.alarabiya.net/en/coronavirus/2020/05/25/Coronavirus-Palestinians-easing-COVID-

The Palestinian Authority (PA) has announced an easing of coronavirus restrictions in the occupied West Bank following a steady drop in the number of new infections.Public transport will also resume and mosques, churches and public parks will reopen, though people will have to obey physical distancing measures.Prime Minister Mohammad Shtayyeh said on Monday shops and businesses will operate as normal from Tuesday, while government employees will return to work after the Eid al-Fitr holiday on Wednesday.  Link:https://web.archive.org/web/20200530092556/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/05/pa-easing-coronavirus-restrictions-occupied-west-bank-200525121054400.html

Saudi Government has announced to pay 60% of the salaries of Saudi employees working in the Private sector for a period of three months with a ceiling of USD 2.39 billion. The Compensation will be paid in accordance with the conditions stipulated in the unemployment insurance system (SANID)
